page.title: 14LOWER HOGSTOW FARM,WORTHEN
page.content: Lower Hogstow Farm on the Leigh road is a dairy farm of 300 acres.The Phillips family have lived there since 1936.There are 120 Friesian heifers, and 20 Limousin ;There is one Hereford bull. Calves are reared mainly for sale.The milking parlour has 12 stalls,two bulk tanks, power washer, and spray,and steralizer.The milk is collected daily and transported to Minsterley Creamery (mainly cheese production).The creamery is about 3 miles away. Cattle are fed on silage, high protein feed nuts(protein pellets,beet pulp nuts,):and corn (rolled oats and barley),some is grown and some bought in. Cattle are grazed on the inproved grass fields;and 51 acres of barley are being grown. Mr. Phillips and one of his sons,with one farmworker work the farm there is a full range of mechanical equipment.
